item.title: Donkey Kong Bananza Preorders - Here's Where To Grab The Upcoming Switch 2 Game
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/donkey-kong-bananza-preorders-heres-where-to-grab-the-upcoming-switch-2-game/1100-6530595/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Of all the big games coming to Nintendo Switch 2, few are as exciting as Donkey Kong Bananza, as it's the character's first big 3D platformer outing since 1999's Donkey Kong 64. While the game doesn't release until July 17--more than a month after the Switch 2--preorders are already live and you can reserve your copy for $70 at multiple online retailers.

You'll find all the preorder details below. We've also found some great deals for Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze and Donkey Kong Country Returns HD for Nintendo Switch (and playable on Switch 2 thanks to backward compatibility) if you need to catch up on Donkey Kong's other adventures.

Donkey Kong Bananza Preorder Bonuses

There are currently no preorder bonuses for Donkey Kong Bananza. If anything is announced, including retailer exclusives, we'll be sure to update this section.

Donkey Kong Bananza is launching exclusively for Nintendo Switch 2. The action-platformer sees him exploring the Underground World as he goes up against a mysterious group known as VoidCo. Beyond that, much is still under wraps. We do know, however, that vast portions of the game world are fully destructible. The reveal trailer showed DK punching and smashing his way through all sorts of terrain, reshaping the landscape in the process.

While DK Bananza is exclusive to Switch 2, current Switch owners can still enjoy old classics like Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze and Donkey Kong Country Returns HD. Both of these are currently seeing nice discounts ahead of Bananza's launch--so if you haven't yet played through the classic adventures, now is the time to dive in.

You could also consider checking out all the upcoming Switch 2 accessories. These run the gamut from Joy-Con and Charging Grips to carrying cases and wheels for Mario Kart World--which can be bundled into your console purchase to save $30. Nintendo Switch 2 is bound to be a hot commodity, so it's a good idea to stay glued to our preorder guide to help you nab one before they sell out. If this launch is anything like that of PS5 and Xbox Series X, it could be a challenge to find one in stock.

Switch 2 Games Available for Preorder

While several games like Mario Kart World and the Switch 2 Editions of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch and Tears of the Kingdom will be available along with the Switch 2 on June 5, there are also plenty of games arriving in the weeks after launch like Donkey Kong Bananza, including Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion, Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition, and Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World Switch 2 Edition--all of which are available to preorder.

  • Switch 2 Exclusives:
  • Mario Kart World -- $80 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition -- $70 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (June 5)
  • Bravely Default Flying Fairy HD Remaster -- $40 (June 5)
  • Donkey Kong Bananza -- $70 (July 17)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (July 24)
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (August 28)
  • More Switch 2 Games:
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma -- $70 (June 5)
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma - Earth Dancer Edition -- $110 (with Switch 2 upgrade)
  • Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition -- $60 (June 5)
  • No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files -- $50 (July 25)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar -- $60 (August 27)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition -- $80 (August 27)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion -- $70 (September 5)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion Limited Edition -- $100 (September 5)

Switch 2 Accessories

If you want something a bit more comfortable than Joy-Con 2, be sure to pick up the Switch 2 Pro Controller. Alternatively, you could invest in the Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip, which keeps your Joy-Con charged up for your next play session. We'd also recommend a carrying case--the Switch 2 isn't cheap, and these offer a simple way to protect your investment.

  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller -- $85
  • Samsung 256GB microSD Express Card -- $60
  • Switch 2 Camera -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack) -- $95
  • Carrying Case & Screen Protector -- $40
  • All-In-One Carrying Case -- $85
  • AC Adapter -- $35
  • Joy-Con 2 (Right, Red Strap) -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 (Left, Blue Strap) -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip -- $40
  • Joy-Con 2 Straps (2-Pack) -- $14
  • Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack) -- $25
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller Preorders Are Available Now
  • Final Fantasy X Magic: The Gathering Card Preorders Restocked At Walmart
  • Middle-earth 6-Film 4K Blu-Ray Collection Is Over 50% Off At Amazon
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)

item.title: Super Mario Party Jamboree Switch 2 Edition Preorders Are Live
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/super-mario-party-jamboree-switch-2-edition-preorders-are-live/1100-6530735/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Super Mario Party Jamboree released for Nintendo Switch last October, and it’s making the jump to Nintendo Switch 2 on July 24. Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV - Switch 2 Edition is a mouthful of a title, but it's simple port. The game will feature improved graphics and frame rates along with heaps of new content thanks to the includied Jamboree TV expansion that adds host of new modes and mini games. Preorders for Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV - Switch 2 Edition are now open at select retailers, while folks with a Switch copy can upgrade the original Switch version of the game for just $20 once it launches. Here’s a look at how you can get your hands on the upcoming game and all its new features.

Super Mario Party Jamboree Switch 2 Edition Preorder Bonuses

There are currently no preorder bonuses for Super Mario Party Jamboree Switch 2 Edition. If anything is announced between now and July 24, we’ll update this section with details.

If you already own Super Mario Party Jamboree on Nintendo Switch, you can pick up all the new content by purchasing the $20 upgrade. This will be available on the Switch 2 eShop. Doing this will upgrade your Switch version of Super Mario Party Jamboree to the Super Mario Party Jamboree Switch 2 Edition, unlocking everything found in the $80 release. In other words, current owners will only need to spend $20 to explore all the new content. This upgrade process works for both physical and digital copies of the Switch game. A physical version of the original Switch game can be found for $52.50 (was $60) at Amazon.

Our Super Mario Party Jamboree review gave it a 6/10 on Switch, noting its original maps were among the best we’ve seen in years, and it’s still a fun party game loaded with chaotic mini games. It was, however, a bit bloated with game modes, and a handful of the games are so slow that they mess with the overall flow of your matches. But if you’re a fan of Mario Party games, there’s still much to love about the latest entry.

Switch 2 Games Available for Preorder

Looking to play games beyond Super Mario Party Jamboree on your new Switch 2? Plenty of other titles are now available to preorder. This includes the relaxing farm simulator Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar and the chaotic Donkey Kong Bananza. Older Switch games are also getting upgrades for Switch 2--and preorders are now open for Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom or Kirby and the Forgotten Land.

  • Switch 2 Exclusives:
  • Mario Kart World -- $80 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild -- $70 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom -- $80 (June 5)
  • Bravely Default Flying Fairy HD Remaster -- $40 (June 5)
  • Donkey Kong Bananza -- $70 (July 17)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV -- $80 (July 24)
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World -- $80 (August 28)
  • More Switch 2 Games:
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma -- $70 (June 5)
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma - Earth Dancer Edition -- $110 (with Switch 2 upgrade)
  • Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition -- $60 (June 5)
  • No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files -- $50 (July 25)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar -- $60 (August 27)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition -- $80 (August 27)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion -- $70 (September 5)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion Limited Edition -- $100 (September 5)

Switch 2 Accessories

The Switch 2 Camera is almost a necessity for Super Mario Party Jamboree, as plenty of new features make use of the device. You might also consider picking up another set of Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack), allowing more people to dive into the fun.

  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller -- $85
  • Samsung 256GB microSD Express Card -- $60
  • Switch 2 Camera -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack) -- $95
  • Carrying Case & Screen Protector -- $40
  • All-In-One Carrying Case -- $85
  • AC Adapter -- $35
  • Joy-Con 2 (Right, Red Strap) -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 (Left, Blue Strap) -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip -- $40
  • Joy-Con 2 Straps (2-Pack) -- $14
  • Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack) -- $25

item.title: GameStop Is Releasing Budget-Friendly Switch 2 Accessories
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gamestop-is-releasing-budget-friendly-switch-2-accessories/1100-6531016/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Nintendo Switch 2 launches on June 5, and it’s shaping up to be a worthy successor to the original handheld console. A slew of first-party Nintendo accessories arrive the same day (including controllers, a camera, and carrying cases), but a recent price hike for these accessories has made them a bit more expensive than anticipated. GameStop has you covered, however, as the retailer is launching its own lineup of branded Switch 2 gear--giving you a chance to pick up a bunch of accessories for cheap. Preorders are now open ahead of their June 5 release.

For more Switch 2 gear and games, be sure to check out our comprehensive Switch 2 preorder guide.

GameStop Switch 2 Accessories

  • Deluxe All-in-One Carry Case -- $30
  • Carry Case -- $20
  • USB-C Dongle with 720p Video Out -- $25
  • Joy-Con 2 - 6-in-1 Charging Station -- $25
  • Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip -- $20
  • Joy-Con 2 Grip (2-Pack) -- $17
  • Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack) -- $17
  • Joy-Con 2 Thumbstick Grip Bundle (6-Pack) -- $10
  • 24-Game Cartridge Case -- $10
  • Tempered Glass Screen Protector -- $15
  • AC Adapter -- $30
  • GameStop 1TB microSD Express Card -- $190
  • GameStop 512GB microSD Express Card -- $100
  • GameStop 256GB microSD Express Card -- $70

There are a lot of great accessories in the GameStop lineup, but it’s the carrying cases that are the most enticing. Nintendo recently raised the prices of the Carrying Case and All-In-One Carrying Case to $40 and $85. However, GameStop is offering similar products for $25 and $35, making them wonderful alternatives for frugal shoppers. The standard Carrying Case provides your handheld with a durable, hardshell exterior, and inside you’ll find slots to hold 10 cartridges. The All-In-One Case, meanwhile, is large enough to lug around your console, dock, charging cables, and other gear.

If you’re planning on adding Mario Kart World to your gaming library, take a look at the Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack). These cost just $17 (compared to Nintendo’s $25), and they look like a decent way for you and a friend to enjoy the chaotic multiplayer action. As a bonus, they’re backward compatible with the original Joy-Con.

Other notable items include a 24-Game Cartridge Case for $10, a versatile Joy-Con 2 Charging Station for $25, and a Thumbstick Grip Bundle for $10. GameSpot also launched a few microSD Express Cards, but these don’t seem like the best value when compared to other options on the market. Prices for these have risen by as much as $40, and you’ll find a Samsung microSD Express Card 256GB for $60 compared to the $70 offered by GameStop.

All of these Switch 2 GameStop accessories are now available to preorder, with a release date scheduled for June 5 (the same day as the console). So if the tariff-induced price hikes of Nintendo’s first-party gear are a bit much to stomach, the GameStop lineup is worth a closer look.

That said, if you're looking to pick up official accessories for the Switch 2 alongside your preorder for the new console, we've compiled all the Switch 2 Accessories available to preorder below. All of the products listed below launch on June 5, the same day as the new console.

Nintendo Switch 2 Official Accessory Preorders

  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller -- $85
  • Samsung 256GB microSD Express Card -- $60
  • Switch 2 Camera -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack) -- $95
  • Carrying Case & Screen Protector -- $40
  • All-In-One Carrying Case -- $85
  • AC Adapter -- $35
  • Joy-Con 2 (Right, Red Strap) -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 (Left, Blue Strap) -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip -- $40
  • Joy-Con 2 Straps (2-Pack) -- $14
  • Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack) -- $25

Nintendo Switch 2 Game Preorders

Switch 2 Exclusives:

  • Mario Kart World -- $80 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition -- $70 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (June 5)
  • Bravely Default Flying Fairy HD Remaster -- $40 (June 5)
  • Donkey Kong Bananza -- $70 (July 17)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (July 24)
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (August 28)

More Switch 2 Games:

  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma -- $70 (June 5)
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma - Earth Dancer Edition -- $110 (with Switch 2 upgrade)
  • Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition -- $60 (June 5)

item.title: Zelda Switch 2 Games And Amiibo Are Up For Preorder
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/legend-of-zelda-nintendo-switch-2-tears-of-the-kingdom-breath-of-the-wild-amiibo-preorder/1100-6530751/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The Nintendo Switch 2 versions of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom are available to preorder now. These upgraded editions of two of the best Switch games will be available when the Switch 2 launches on June 5. Existing owners can purchase an upgrade from the eShop for $10 each to gain access to the Switch 2 versions, but physical copies with new Switch 2 packaging are available as well. Tears of the Kingdom and Breath of the Wild are launching alongside four new Amiibo figures based on the Champions from Tears of the Kingdom: Tulin, Yunobo, Sidon, and Riju.

Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom are among a handful of select Nintendo Switch games getting upgraded versions with new content on Nintendo Switch 2. Like other Switch 2 Edition games, Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Editions will offer better visuals and performance than their Switch 1 versions, and will include additional features like support for the all-new Zelda Notes app, which offers daily login item bonuses, a helpful map that shows your in-game location in real time, the ability to share stats with other players online, and more.

Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom each have a much larger emphasis on inventory management than the older Zelda games, and the controls can be somewhat cumbersome at times. These are games that greatly benefit from controllers with remappable back buttons. Thankfully, the official Switch 2 Pro Controller has a pair of built-in back buttons. If you're interested in the Switch 2 versions of these Zelda games, you may want to snag a preorder for the Switch 2 Pro Controller, too. The Switch 2 Pro Controller releases alongside the games and console on June 5.

The Legend of Zelda New Amiibo Figures

The new batch of Zelda Amiibo feature expressive poses from fan-favorites from Tears of the Kingdom. The new set includes the first four Champions Link partners up with during his quest to save Hyrule: Tulin, Yunobo, Sidon, and Riju. All four are available to preorder for $30 each, which is nearly twice the price Nintendo charged for several previous Tears of the Kingdom Amiibo figures.

Zelda Official Strategy Guides

It's also worth noting that the official guidebooks for Tears of the Kingdom and Breath of the Wild are still available to purchase, and you can save big on hardcover editions at Amazon.

What are Switch 2 Edition games?

Nintendo Switch 2 Edition games are upgraded versions of Switch 1 games featuring enhancements exclusively for Switch 2. Along with The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom, several other Switch 2 Editions were announced at the April 2 Switch 2 Direct showcase, including versions for existing games like Super Mario Party Jamboree and Kirby and the Forgotten Land that include visual enhancements and all-new, exclusive content, as well as upcoming Switch 1 games like Metroid Prime 4: Beyond and Pokemon Legends Z-A.

All Switch 2 Editions Games

Preorders available now:

  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition -- $70 | Releases June 5
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Edition -- $80 | Releases June 5
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV -- $80 | Releases July 24
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World -- $80 | Releases August 28

Coming soon:

  • Metroid Prime 4: Beyond -- Price TBA | Releases 2025
  • Pokemon Legends: Z-A -- Price TBA | Releases Late 2025

All of these games will be available as standalone physical and digital versions or digital upgrades for those who own the Switch 1 versions. Note that Switch 2 Edition games are separate from simply playing Switch 1 Edition games on the new Switch 2 console via backward compatibility, which you'll be able to do for free.

The Switch 2 will also have plenty of all-new exclusives, including the system's big launch title, Mario Kart World, as well as a decent list of other new games to look forward to after the system releases, such as Donkey Kong Bananza on July 17--not to mention a long list of third-party games like Bravely Default: Flying Fairy HD, Street Fighter 6, and more. You can see a full list of all the confirmed Nintendo Switch 2 games below. As for where you can preorder the console and its various accessories, you'll find all the info in our Nintendo Switch 2 preorder guide.

Nintendo Switch 2 Games at Walmart

Switch 2 Exclusives:

  • Mario Kart World -- $80 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition -- $70 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (June 5)
  • Bravely Default Flying Fairy HD Remaster -- $40 (June 5)
  • Donkey Kong Bananza -- $70 (July 17)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (July 24)
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (August 28)

More Switch 2 Games:

  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma -- $70 (June 5)
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma - Earth Dancer Edition -- $110 (with Switch 2 upgrade)
  • Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition -- $60 (June 5)
  • No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files -- $50 (July 25)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar -- $60 (August 27)
  • Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Premium Edition -- $80 (August 27)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion -- $70 (September 5)
  • Daemon X Machina: Titanic Scion Limited Edition -- $100 (September 5)

More Nintendo Switch 2 Official Accessory Preorders

  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller -- $85
  • Samsung 256GB microSD Express Card -- $60
  • Switch 2 Camera -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack) -- $95
  • Carrying Case & Screen Protector -- $40
  • All-In-One Carrying Case -- $85
  • AC Adapter -- $35
  • Joy-Con 2 (Right, Red Strap) -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 (Left, Blue Strap) -- $55
  • Joy-Con 2 Charging Grip -- $40
  • Joy-Con 2 Straps (2-Pack) -- $14
  • Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack) -- $25

item.title: Mario Kart World Switch 2 Game & Accessory Preorders Are Live
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/mario-kart-world-switch-2-game-accessory-preorders-are-live/1100-6530753/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Mario Kart World launches exclusively for Nintendo Switch 2 on June 5, the same day as the new console. Nintendo's new open-world racing game is easily the console's biggest launch title, and preorders are now live alongside the Switch 2 with multiple options are available. Fans can preorder Mario Kart World on its own for $80, or grab a $500 bundle that includes the Switch 2 and a download code for the game.

Quick look: Mario Kart World & related Switch 2 products

  • Mario Kart World -- $79 (June 5)
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Mario Kart World Console Bundle -- $500
  • Joy-Con 2 Racing Wheels (2-Pack) -- $25
  • Joy-Con 2 Controllers (2-Pack) -- $94
  • Joy-Con 2 (Right, Red Strap) -- $54
  • Joy-Con 2 (Left, Blue Strap) -- $54
  • Nintendo Switch 2 Pro Controller -- $84

For a comprehensive look at all the Switch 2 games and accessories available, as well as a list of where you can find the console itself, be sure to check our Switch 2 preorder guide.

Mario Kart World

$80 | Releases June 5

Like other Switch 2 launch games, Mario Kart World is getting a standard edition that will run you $80. That pricing applies to physical and digital versions alike. That's a big step up from the $60 average for Nintendo Switch games and $70 average for PS5 and Xbox Series X games. There are no extras or special features included in this version--it's just the base game. However, you'll get a physical copy to add to your shelf, and the full game is on the cartridge. You can preorder physical copies of Mario Kart World standard edition at Walmart, Target, GameStop, and Best Buy.

Joy-Con 2 Wheel Set

$25 | Releases June 5

You can use standard stick and button inputs to race, but Mario Kart World will also support motion controls, allowing players to tilt their controllers like a real steering wheel for increased immersion. If you plan on using the tilt controls, check out Nintendo's official Joy-Con 2 Wheel Set.

These controller attachments actually look quite nice for the price, with textured covers reminiscent of actual steering wheels. It's also cool that each two-pack comes with one red and one blue wheel to match the color accents on the left and right Joy-Con 2 Controllers.

GameStop is releasing its own Joy-Con 2 Wheels. Two-packs of red and black wheels cost $17. It's hard to say for sure without testing both of them, but GameStop's attachments certainly look cheaper.

Alternatively, you can race with the Switch 2 Pro Controller and remap inputs, such as drifting, to the pair of back buttons Nintendo added to its new traditional controller.

Mario Kart World looks to be a gorgeous, expansive new entry in the long-running arcade racing series, offering a fully explorable world map for the first time. Players will be able to explore on- and off-road alongside other players, take on unique mission challenges scattered around the world, or engage in traditional racing and battle modes across numerous all-new tracks. The game will also have a staggering roster of up to 84 playable characters, with up to 24 competing at a time in the various racing modes. This is the Switch 2's marquee launch title, and if you're interested in learning more, be sure to check our latest Mario Kart World hands-on impressions.

More Nintendo Switch 2 Games

While Mario Kart is the biggest Switch 2 launch title, it's not the only game releasing for the new console on June 5. You can also pick up the Switch 2 Editions of The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild and Tears of the Kingdom, which will feature enhanced visuals and integration with a new smartphone app that lets you check the map and other new features right from your phone. Other Switch 2 games launching on June 5 include a port of Capcom's popular fighting game Street Fighter 6. These new Switch 2 Editions of Zelda and Street Fighter 6 are also getting new sets of Amiibo that are available to preorder as well. There are even more Switch 2 games available to preorder, and you'll find a list of them all below.

Switch 2 Exclusives:

  • Mario Kart World -- $80 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Switch 2 Edition -- $70 (June 5)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (June 5)
  • Bravely Default Flying Fairy HD Remaster -- $40 (June 5)
  • Donkey Kong Bananza -- $70 (July 17)
  • Super Mario Party Jamboree + Jamboree TV Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (July 24)
  • Kirby and the Forgotten Land + Star-Crossed World Switch 2 Edition -- $80 (August 28)

More Switch 2 Games:

  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma -- $70 (June 5)
  • Rune Factory: Guardians of Azuma - Earth Dancer Edition -- $110 (with Switch 2 upgrade)
  • Street Fighter 6: Years 1-2 Fighters Edition -- $60 (June 5)
  • No Sleep For Kaname Date - From AI: The Somnium Files -- $50 (July 25)
